choices.A: To define the capabilities of the organization
choices.C: To evaluate the readiness of the organization to undergo change
choices.B: To communicate the technical readiness of the project
choices.D: To produce a new Request for Architecture Work

questions.question_text: Which one of the following describes a purpose of an Architecture Compliance review?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
42.3 Architecture Compliance Reviews
42.3.1 Purpose
Communicate to management the status of technical readiness of the project


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/m/chap42.html

Selected Answer: B
...readiness of the project

Correct Answer - B. To communicate the technical readiness of the project

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap42.html#tag_42_03

Selected Answer: C
14.3 Architecture Views and Viewpoints
Architecture views are an ideal mechanism to purposefully convey information about architecture areas. In general, a view is defined as a part of an Architecture Description that addresses a set of related concerns and is tailored for specific stakeholders. 

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/archimate3-doc/chap14.html

Correct Answer - C. According to TOGAF, a view is used to describe the concerns of a stakeholder.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap03.html#tag_03_17

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence by selecting the applicable pair of words. According to TOGAF, a/an _____ is used to describe the ____ of a stakeholder.
Complete the sentence. In TOGAF, every architecture view has an associated ____ that describes it, at least implicitly.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Basic Concepts
• Every view has an associated viewpoint that describes it, at least implicitly. 

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf8-doc/arch/chap31.html
Correct Answer - E. In TOGAF, every architecture view has an associated viewpoint that describes it, at least implicitly.

Selected Answer: D
33.3 Building Blocks and the ADM
33.3.1 Basic Principles
33.3.1.2 Building Block Design
• Consider three classes of building blocks:
o Re-usable building blocks, such as legacy items
o Building blocks to be the subject of development, such as new applications
o Building blocks to be the subject of purchase; i.e., Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) applications

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap33.html#tag_33_02

Correct Answer --- D. Re-usable Building Blocks

Link : https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf8-doc/arch/chap32.html

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. In TOGAF, legacy systems and processes that are going to be used again in the future are considered ______

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
4.4.2 Extending the TRM
The TOGAF TRM identifies a generic set of platform services, and provides a taxonomy in which these platform services are divided into categories of like functionality. 



https://pubs.opengroup.org/togaf-standard/reference-models/trm.html

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The TOGAF Technical Reference Model _____

choices.D: is intended to contain the Enterprise Continuum
choices.B: must be used "as is" for developing comprehensive architecture models
choices.A: is an example and should be tailored to the needs of an organization
